name: Dal Tadka

steps.instruction: In a pressure cooker, add 1 cup washed toor dal, 3 cups water, half teaspoon turmeric, and 1 teaspoon salt.
safety: Ensure pressure cooker lid is properly sealed

steps.instruction: Close the lid and cook on high heat until you hear 3 whistles. Then reduce to low heat for 10 minutes.
safety: CRITICAL: Do not open pressure cooker until pressure is fully released
Keep children and pets away from pressure cooker

steps.instruction: Turn off heat and let pressure release naturally. This takes about 10 minutes.
safety: Do not force open the lid
Wait for pressure indicator to drop completely

steps.instruction: Open the lid carefully. Mash the dal slightly with a whisk. Set aside.
safety: Hot steam will escape when opening
Use oven mitts to handle lid

steps.instruction: For tadka: Heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a small pan over medium heat.
Add 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, half teaspoon mustard seeds, and a pinch of asafoetida. Let them crackle.
safety: Seeds will pop - stand back slightly

steps.instruction: Add minced garlic and whole red chilies. Saut√© until garlic turns golden, about 1 minute.
Add half teaspoon garam masala. Stir for 5 seconds.
Pour this hot tadka over the cooked dal. Mix well.
safety: Pour carefully to avoid splashing hot oil

steps.instruction: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.
safety: Let it cool slightly before eating

tips: If dal is too thick, add hot water to adjust consistency
For extra flavor, add a squeeze of lemon juice before serving
Can use oil instead of ghee for a vegan version
